result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob C Valley

defendant.name: Valley, Jacob C
defendant.address: 725 S Main Street APT 126, Shawano, WI 54166

records.addlTxt: No consumption of alcohol. Not to discuss this case with victim, Nolan Valley.

2:21 PM  Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob C Valley in court, in custody, from Forest County Jail.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Jacob C Valley. State calls first witness Lt. Andrew Karcz as first witness. Sworn in 2:21 PM. State directs. Record reflects proper identification of defendant, 2:26 PM. Halyburton cross-examines witness, 2:27 PM. Witness excused, 2:31 PM. Halyburton makes argument, state has not made burden of proof for reasons as stated on the record and asks court to not bind over. State makes argument. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial, makes statement in regards to purposes of this hearing. Information has been filed. Halyburton has received a copy of information and waives further reading, would like to proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas and will have set for trial. Halyburton asks for reduction of bond, asking for signature bond for reasons as indicated on the record. State makes statement and objects to signature bond. Court imposes $2000 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol, not to discuss this case with victim, Nolan Valley.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob C Valley appeared by video, in custody, FC jail.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for Jacob C Valley. Set for BBH. Halyburton filed a motion for bail/bond and makes argument for reduction of bond, asking for a high signature bond, does not object to any non-monetary conditions, would reside with mother in Shawano which is included in the motion. State objects to any reduction of bond for reasons as stated on the record - two open warrants. Court continues the $750 cash and can be reviewed at ARGN. Halyburton asks if AIA can be handled today. Court was previously advised of charges. Halyburton has went over charges, waives further reading and asks for PH, willing to waive time limits for PH. Court considers time limits waived and has set for PH.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on June 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No violent contact with child NV.

9:43 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob C Valley appeared by video, in custody, from FC jail. Valley has not received a copy of the complaint. State to provide a copy of the complaint to Mr. Valley at the jail. Court reads charges and penalties. Valley understands. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Valley has tried to contacted SPD, has attorney on another case. Court instructs to contact SPD and advise of new charges. State asks for $750 cash bond for reasons as indicated on the record. Court questions defendant. Court sets bond at $750 cash. No violent contact with NV.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 09:15 am.
